profile.name: Alejandro
profile.description:
Hello! I'm Alejandro Gálvez, born 30 years ago in Zaragoza. 

I studied Computer Engineering in Zaragoza University and specialized in 'Big Data'. At that moment, 'Big Data' was something new, what I studied was Data Warehouses, Data Mining, etc. 

Sadly, I finished the degree when de economic crisis was still trending, so I had to accept a job as a Junio BackEnd developer after I graduated. In Zaragoza, the concep of "Big Data" didn't exist at that moment. 
After studying hard by myself different programming languages like Scala or Python, develop several personal projects with Spark, Kafka and other Big Data technologies and enroll in different coursera courses related with Functional Programming, Data Science, Reactive Programming, etc. I finally made mi first steps in the "Big Data World". 

I always thought that our profession is more about self-studying and experience than careers. 
For this reason, in my 4th year of degree I worked at the same time I studied and currently I try to study new technologies and try to keep improving my skills in my free time. 

I'll work hard in order to obtain a job that gives me freedom. I want to work from wherever I want and, if possible, with flexible schedule. I think that my work talks by itself and I don't need to justify my work hours sitting in a chair. 

In my short career I've been able to work for startups (Idiogram Techonolgies, Mirai) and big companies (Telefonica, Santillana Global) and I've learned the good and bad points of both types of company. In the last two years I worked for Stratio and Plain Concepts, where I have embraced the scrum methodology and self-managed working groups.
At the same time, I've learned that I have to reach an equilibrium between salary and responsabilities, something that sadly doesn't happen in my current job. 

I like working with people that knows more than me about stuff related with the job, learning new things while I'm working and help others as well as ask for help when needed. 

I consider myself a good teamplayer, however I can be too "straight" when talking with the clients. Also, I may be a bit too "picky" with everything related with the number of work hours. 

One of my dreams is keep working in remote and being able to save enough money to buy my own house.

challenges.description:
Plain Concepts it's known in Spain by the technical excellence of the solutions they develop for their clients and the high professionalism of their employees. 
As a FullStack developer, I had to work for different clients writing JavaScript code for the BackEnd and React or Angular for the FrontEnd. Also, I did client trainings in several technologies like ELK (thanks to my Data Engineer background) and consultings related with data base performance and optimisations.

In addition, Plain structures the Engineers in self-managed groups, so my responsibilities included communicating to clients, defining and writing new project proposals, managing critical situations, etc.

The methodology used was Scrum, including liturgies like 'planning', 'demo to clients' and 'retrospectives'.

Client: Carrefour

Carrefour has a Data Warehouse (DW) system where stores huge volumes of data related with stores, hyper markets, stock, providers and so on. The amount of daily transactions is, also, really high. 
As a BigData Engineer, my role is the maintenance, improvement and development of the spark processes which ingest the DW daily.

Client: Santillana global S.L.

Santillana offers to the students different web tools to improve their learning experience. In order to manage the students results, the teachers are provided with a dashboard where they can evaluate their students. 

To generate this dashboard, the logs of the different tools are extracted, transformed and loaded (ETL) in parquet files using Amazon Glue and Spark. Calling REST micro services, this information is shown in the dashboard, using Amazon Athena to query the data. 

At the same time, legacy code had to be fixed and maintained.

As part of Mirai's back-end developers team, I had to analyse the requisites, design the low level architecture, code, test and deploy new functionalities.

Overall, I developed software related with hotels management and statistical reports. This reports used a different DDBB to extract data, MongoDB specifically. The ETL process which migrated the data from PostgreSQL to MongoDB was one of my biggest achievements.

Also, I had to develop Front-end related stories, using JQuery, JSPs, CSS Styles, etc. This developments where focused in the company's intranet, where hoteliers configure their hotels.

Another business branch was the third-party integration with brands like Google, Trivago, TripAdvisor,etc. I contributed in the development of Trivago's ExpressBooking and Google's HotelAds API integration.
